questions.text: Which is formed by 3 bones?
Blood supply of the marked structure.
A known case of leprosy presented to the Dermatology OPD with the complaints of deformity in his left hand as shown in the figure. Such a deformity is because of palsy of:

In a hunting accident, an arrow pierces the mid-calf of a hunter. A major artery is lacerated in the posterior leg, and you notice that the sole of his foot is cold and pale. The dorsum of the foot is warm and normally colored. The artery that seems to be injured is the:
Neurotransmitter secreted by the marked area is
A systolic murmur that becomes more prominent on standing is a feature of:
Atrial fibrillation leads to disappearance of following clinical sign/signs:
Following statements about Barlow’s syndrome are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: Myxomatous degeneration affects posterior valve leaflet more commonly

options.label: C
options.text: MVP is the most common cause of isolated mitral regurgitation

options.label: D
options.text: Risk of IE is low when it is associated with Mitral regurgitation

questions.correct_answer: D. Risk of IE is low when it is associated with Mitral regurgitation

questions.text: 10 yr boy is admitted with infective endocarditis. On examination Gibson’s murmur is audible. Mother gives H/O Rubella infection during pregnancy. The most likely diagnosis in this case is:
All of the following features are seen in Pseudobulbar palsy EXCEPT:

A 63-year-old female presented to the emergency room with an acute aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) and underwent a clipping procedure on admission. She has since been recovering in the intensive care unit. On the tenth postoperative day, she was noted to have slurred speech, worsening right facial droop, and right arm weakness. She was more difficult to rouse. NCCT and four-vessel angiogram are shown shows ischemia in MCA territory. Which of the following is the best treatment for her condition?
Following statements about Subdural hematoma are true Except:

options.label: A
options.text: Maybe Spontaneous in Elderly and alcoholics

options.label: C
options.text: Source of bleeding is Bridging veins

options.label: D
options.text: Prognosis with early surgery is excellent.

questions.correct_answer: D. Prognosis with early surgery is excellent.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman with prior history of IV drug abuse resulting in hepatitis C coinfection is seen in a prenatal clinic for routine care. She is in the third trimester of pregnancy with her first child. Which of the following statements regarding transmission of hepatitis C virus (HCV) to neonate is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Caesarean section reduces the risk of transmission to a greater degree than vaginal delivery.

options.label: B
options.text: Risk of transmission is 5% to neonate.

options.label: C
options.text: Breastfeeding is associated with very high risk of transmission.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with HCV genotype 1 have a greater risk of transmission than other genotypes.

questions.correct_answer: B. Risk of transmission is 5% to neonate.

questions.text: A 32-year-old female with past history of rheumatic fever (20 years back) that was treated with antibiotics. She is asymptomatic. Her physical examination shows a heart rate of 70 beats per minute with a blood pressure of 122/77 mm Hg. She has no jugular venous distention. Her lungs are clear. She has a regular rate and rhythm with a loud S1. A soft early diastolic rumble is heard at the apex with an opening snap after S2. There is wide separation between A2 and the opening snap. No peripheral edema is present. Which of the following is the most appropriate next recommendation for this patient?
Identify the true statement regarding the condition shown in the following Xray:

options.label: A
options.text: Majority cases are due to trauma

options.label: C
options.text: Intercostal drainage tube placement is indicated

options.label: D
options.text: Pleurodesis must be performed to prevent recurrence in all cases

questions.correct_answer: C. Intercostal drainage tube placement is indicated

questions.text: a a a a Identify the phenomenon in DM and choose the correct statement/s about it. 1. The picture shows Dawn phenomenon 2. It is due to excess night-time dose of Insulin 3. Patient needs Increase in night-time dose of Insulin 4. The phenomenon is physiological due to GH surge in early morning hours
Which of the following parameter is no longer recommended for the diagnosis of AKI?
Match the urinary casts with probable diagnosis

25-year-old male presents to an ENT clinic with sensorineural deafness. He has no history of ear infection or any illicit drug use in the past. Systemic examination reveals normal Blood pressure. He complains of recurrent loin pain in the past with hematuria. His renal function test reveals elevated Creatinine and urine examination revealed eumorphic RBC’s. other systemic examination is normal. What is the likely diagnosis?

55-year-old male suffering from DM and HTN for 7 years underwent a routine ECG. ECG revealed Tall t waves and prolonged PR interval. Laboratory results revealed an elevated serum Potassium level, normal Creatinine with low Bicarbonate levels. His medications include Glimepiride+Metformin combination for his diabetes along with Telmisartan+Amlodepine combination for hypertension. Which finding is expected in this patient?

Following statements about Tocilizumab in COVID are true except

options.label: C
options.text: There is decrease in IL6 levels post-tocilizumab use

questions.correct_answer: C. There is decrease in IL6 levels post-tocilizumab use

questions.text: Which of the following is a cause of Lactic Acidosis- Type A?

A 45/M had COVID pneumonia with spo2 85 % & had to be intubated for respiratory failure. His Neutrophil / Lymphocyte ratio is 7, CRP is 80 ug /mL , ferritin 1000ng /ml , D-dimer : 0.4 ug/ml & he weighs 60 Kg. At a fraction of inspired O2 (FiO2) of 60%, with a PEEP of 10cm h20, tidal volume 600ml his SpO2 was 97% (normal 94–100%) . Suddenly, he developed oxygen desaturation (SpO 2) of 77% and a worse respiratory pattern. His chest xray is given below . True regarding management is :.

options.label: B
options.text: Start IV infusion of unfractionated heparin

questions.text: A 28 year old actress presented with a four week history of breathlessness. She had returned from Himalayan trekking six weeks ago. She had no cough but had intermittent chest tightness and had been started on Salbutamol with no improvement. Results showed a normal Chest X-ray, ECG and spirometry. Oxygen saturations were 99% on air at rest and after walking up a flight of stairs. Her ABG Shows Ph ; 7.50 , Pao2 : 94 mmhg , Paco2 : 28 mmhg , HCO3- : 20 meq /L . What is the most likely diagnosis?
Very slow, irregular, twisting movement, one movement perpetually blending with another is called:
Ankylosing spondylitis is a type of Axial dominant arthropathy. Which of the following components of patient history is more commonly associated with ankylosing spondylitis?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute, spontaneous onset of low back pain

options.label: B
options.text: Onset of symptoms after age 50 years

options.label: D
options.text: Symptoms are typically worse in the morning

questions.correct_answer: D. Symptoms are typically worse in the morning

questions.text: Identify the disease based on the polarising microscopy finding

A 70-year-old female presents with complaints of severe unilateral headache which is unresponsive to anti-migraine treatment. She also reports myalgia with low grade fever and weight loss. She is most likely suffering from:

35 years old male comes with cough associated with haemoptysis. He also noticed passing blood in the urine. He has a purpuric skin rash over the lower limbs. Ocular examination reveals pan-uveitis and he also has conductive deafness due to serous otitis media. What is the diagnosis?

A 30-hour-old boy, who has not yet passed meconium, develops abdominal distention associated with bilious vomiting. A plain radiograph of the abdomen shows distended loops of bowel with air-fluid levels. A contrast enema demonstrates a normal caliber rectum, a small caliber sigmoid, and a descending colon with an abrupt caliber transition at the splenic flexure. Which of the following medications did the mother of this infant most likely require during her pregnancy?
Which of the following findings on newborn physical examination is most often associated with congenital abnormalities?

options.label: A
options.text: Pinkish-red macular stains of the eyelid(s)

questions.text: You are called to the delivery of a preterm infant whose mother received no prenatal care. She presented to the hospital ready to deliver. By dates, the infant is 34 weeks of gestational age. In the delivery room, the baby requires intubation and mechanical ventilation. On physical examination, bulging of the abdominal wall and absence of abdominal wall musculature are noted. Ultrasound demonstrates dysplastic kidneys and severe dilatation of the bladder resulting from urinary flow obstruction. Which of the following is the anomaly most commonly associated with this disorder?
Which of the following developmental reflexes can be elicited in a healthy 1-year-old child?

A 2-month-old infant presents with his foster parents for an initial evaluation. Little is known about his biological mother’s medical history. She reportedly received no prenatal care and presented to the emergency department in active labor while denying previous knowledge of her pregnancy. The infant is noted to have several dysmorphic features that include arched eyebrows, hypertelorism, a short upturned nose, and shortened stubby digits with hypoplastic nails. Which of the following was the infant most likely exposed to in utero?

During a health maintenance visit a 4-month-old female is noted to have a skull deformity due to premature fusion of both coronal sutures and 1 sagittal suture. Which of the following additional findings on physical examination would indicate that this patient’s cranial abnormalities are consistent with Apert, rather than Crouzon's syndrome?

options.label: C
options.text: Syndactyly of the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th fingers and toes

options.label: D
options.text: Congenital stenosis or atresia of the external ear canals

questions.correct_answer: C. Syndactyly of the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th fingers and toes

questions.text: A newborn female is evaluated in the nursery. The mother had poor, late care and reports that she took warfarin during her pregnancy because of a history of a deep venous thrombosis. The most likely physical finding for this infant is:

A 10-hour-old male is noted to have bradycardia. An ECG shows a ventricular rate of 54 beats/minute. The atrial rate varies from 90 to 110 beats/minute. The QRS morphology is normal. Which of the following is most likely to be associated with these clinical and electrocardiographic findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Clustered small white papules on the cheeks

options.label: B
options.text: Annular discoid lesions on the scalp and face

options.label: C
options.text: Papules and papulopustules, some of which have ruptured, leaving a fine scale and associated hyperpigmentation on the forehead

options.label: D
options.text: Indurate erythematous plaques on the shoulders and back

options.label: E
options.text: Blotchy erythematous macules and edematous papules on the chest

questions.correct_answer: B. Annular discoid lesions on the scalp and face

questions.text: A 6-year-old male is brought to the emergency department because of abdominal pain, diarrhea, bilateral knee pain with swelling, and purpuric rash on his legs. These symptoms started approximately 2 weeks after an upper respiratory infection. Workup reveals leukocytosis and elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate. The serum chemistry panel and urinalysis are normal. What is the best next step in managing this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Treat with hydration and pain medications.

questions.correct_answer: C. Treat with hydration and pain medications.

questions.text: Which of the following tests is most specific for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)?
questions.correct_answer: C. Anti-double stranded DNA antibody (dsDNA ab)

questions.text: A patient who is 3 years old comes to you with widespread blisters in the skin. On examination, you find that the nikolsky sign is positive. What is the likely diagnosis in this case ?

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: D. Enlarged corneal nerves might be seen

questions.text: The given sign is probably seen in which of the folowing?
The chart is useful for all except?
Space between retina and vitreous is?

A 42 year old diabetic patient complain of diplopia, which was more when he sees objects to right. The doctor examines him and notices finding as in the given pic. MRI head and orbit was normal. Which is false?

options.label: A
options.text: There can be right lateral rectus palsy

options.label: B
options.text: There can be secondary contraction of right medial rectus

options.label: C
options.text: He compensates diplopia by right face turn

options.label: D
options.text: If surgery is needed, right Lateral rectus recession is done

questions.correct_answer: D. If surgery is needed, right Lateral rectus recession is done

questions.text: Secretory otitis media is an effusion in the middle ear resulting from incomplete resolution of acute otitis media or obstruction of the eustachian tube without infection. Choose the most inappropriate statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Varying head posture may alter the degree of deafness.

options.label: B
options.text: A mobile eardrum excludes the diagnosis.

options.label: D
options.text: Chronic suppurative otitis media with cholesteatoma may be a late sequela.

questions.correct_answer: B. A mobile eardrum excludes the diagnosis.

questions.text: Type III branchial fistulas that open into the pharynx most commonly can be found at which of the following locations?

options.label: A
options.text: The junction of the hard and soft palates

questions.text: What are the anatomic elements of the internal nasal valve?

options.label: A
options.text: The caudal margin of the upper lateral cartilage (ULC), the anterior head of the inferior turbinate, and the adjacent septum.

options.label: B
options.text: The cephalic margin of the ULC, the anterior head of the inferior turbinate, and the adjacent septum.

options.label: C
options.text: The cephalic margin of the ULC, the medial crus of the lower lateral cartilages, and the posterior septum.

options.label: D
options.text: The caudal margin of the ULC, the anterior head of the inferior turbinate, and the alar rim.

questions.correct_answer: A. The caudal margin of the upper lateral cartilage (ULC), the anterior head of the inferior turbinate, and the adjacent septum.

questions.text: You are asked to evaluate a 5 month old baby with bilateral microtia and atresia.What is your most important recommendation?

options.label: C
options.text: Placement of bone conduction hearing aid

options.label: D
options.text: Plan to perform surgical correction at 10 weeks

questions.correct_answer: C. Placement of bone conduction hearing aid

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate statement regarding “Audiological investigations”

options.label: A
options.text: Retrocochlear deafness gives speech discrimination far better than expected from pure tone thresholds.

options.label: B
options.text: Car hart’s test is a loss seen in air conduction.

options.label: C
options.text: Recruitment is uncommon in both cochlear and neural hearing losses but usual in conductive losses.

options.label: D
options.text: Conductive deaf patient experience comfort in noisy surrounding.

questions.correct_answer: D. Conductive deaf patient experience comfort in noisy surrounding.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man being treated for T3N2c squamous cell carcinoma of the larynx with adjuvant chemoradiation has significant pain during the fifth week of radiation, requiring hospitalization for fluids and pain control. What should be done with the patient’s treatment during the hospitalization?

options.label: A
options.text: Discontinue radiation and do not resume

options.label: B
options.text: Defer radiation until patient is discharged

questions.correct_answer: C. Continue radiation while patient admitted

questions.text: Treatment of malignant tumors of the paranasal sinuses includes:

options.label: A
options.text: Sublabial antrostomy for biopsy is contraindicated because of the risk of tumour implantation.

options.label: B
options.text: If the tumor penetrates the cribriform plate it is inoperable.

options.label: C
options.text: Radical surgery followed by radiotherapy gives 5 year survival figures unlikely to exceed 35%.

options.label: D
options.text: Cytotoxic drug treatment is the first line of management.

questions.correct_answer: C. Radical surgery followed by radiotherapy gives 5 year survival figures unlikely to exceed 35%.

A 24 years old Primigravida underwent full term normal delivery. During controlled cord traction, there was an avulsion of the cord. What is the next line of management?
questions.correct_answer: D. Do manual removal of placenta

questions.text: A 29 years old G2P1L1 with full term gestation. Her previous sonography at 34 weeks revealed that there is placenta on the posterior wall of the uterus with an extra lobe of placenta on the anterior wall of the uterus. There were fetal vessels connecting the extra lobe with the placenta. The vessels were found running above the internal os. What is your diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Velamentous placenta with vasa previa type 1

options.label: B
options.text: Succenturiate placenta with vasa previa type 2

options.label: C
options.text: Vanishing twin syndrome with residual placenta

questions.text: According to the amendment of MTP act (2020), which one of the following is correct?

options.text: For contraceptive failure, mtp can be done till 20 weeks but two doctors will be needed if more than 12 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: For pregnancy due to rape, mtp can be done even beyond 24 weeks after forming the medical board

options.label: C
options.text: For gross congenital anomalies, the limit for mtp is extended till 24 weeks.

options.text: Fetal urine is the most predominant source of amniotic fluid in later half of pregnancy

questions.text: Fill in the blanks: 1: primary amenorrhoea + 46XY + uterus seen in usg =_______ 2: primary amenorrhoea +46XY + uterus is absent and clitoromegaly is present = ________
questions.correct_answer: B. 1: Pure gonadal dysgenesis, 2: Partial AIS

questions.text: A 27 years old patient has secondary amenorrhoea since last 7 months. She has history of anxiety disorder for which she is on medications since last 4 years. She has history of PPH in her pregnancy 3 years back. She has history of D and C done 5 months back for missed abortion. Her Sr. FSH is 4 IU/L done 2 days back. A 67 years old post-menopausal patient has bleeding since last 4 months. On speculum examination, cervix and vagina are atrophied. On TVS, there is a sub-mucosal pedunculated growth of 4 cm size. Her Hb is 12gm%. The bleeding has stopped since last 7 days. What is the next best line of management?

questions.text: A 27 years old nulliparous patient has irregular menses, hirsutism and acne. What is not the likely cause?

questions.text: A 65 years old postmenopausal lady underwent hysteroscopy guided endometrial biopsy which revealed well differentiated endometrioid adenocarcinoma. options.label: C
options.text: Type 1 hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy with post-operative radiotherapy

options.label: D
options.text: Type 3 hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy with post-operative radiotherapy

questions.correct_answer: D. It takes less time to cut and coagulate tissues than diathermy

questions.text: A patient underwent laparotomy for enteric perforation. After 5 days salmon pink sign was observed which eventually led to gaping of wound. Which of the following is a false statement about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: This should be treated later on with tension suturing

options.label: B
options.text: It should be closed in layers

options.label: C
options.text: Non absorbable monofilament sutures are best to close this wound

options.label: D
options.text: Obesity, malnutrition and anaemia are known risk factors.

questions.correct_answer: A. This should be treated later on with tension suturing

questions.text: Which among the following statements regarding the image shown below which is numbered as 1,2 and 3 is false?

questions.correct_answer: A. Zone 1 – Penetrating hematomas should always be explored while blunt injury hematoma are managed conservatively

After insufflating the abdomen using a Veress needle, a trocar is inserted just inferior to the umbilicus with an immediate rush of bright red blood. The next step of management should be:

options.label: A
options.text: Keep the trocar in place and perform a laparotomy

options.label: B
options.text: Resume insufflation and insert the laparoscope to identify the injury

options.label: C
options.text: Apply manual pressure to the abdomen

options.label: D
options.text: Remove the trocar and perform a laparotomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Keep the trocar in place and perform a laparotomy

A 28 year old female with 32 weeks of gestation presents in emergency department with severe left upper abdominal pain radiation to her left shoulder. He is a known case of DM and HT. Her BMI is 30 Kg/m2. On examination her BP is 98/ 60 mmHg and Pulse rate is 112/min. CECT showed a secular lesion behind the tail of pancreas. Which of the following physiological condition is most likely to be positive in her case?

A 44-year-old female is found to have a very large left breast that has been increasing in size over the past 3 months. There is a bosselated mobile huge mass measuring 8 cm. The biopsy shows fibrous stromal proliferation with an epithelial lining. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient of SRS positive GI malignant carcinoid, not fit for surgery, with multiple liver secondaries is best treated by?

Her LFT showed Bilirubin 2.6 mg%, SGOT and SGPT 55 and 62 IU/L, ALP – 450 IU/L. ERCP showed a passable narrowing at junction of cystic duct with CBD. image is given below. What is the best treatment for her?

questions.text: Which of the following is a false statement about Groove pancreatitis?

options.label: A
options.text: More common in males aged 40-50 years with a history of alcohol/ tobacco abuse

options.label: B
options.text: The pathogenesis of groove pancreatitis is obstruction of the minor papilla

options.label: C
options.text: Pathological findings are cystic lesions in the duodenal wall, Brunner gland hyperplasia, dilation of Santorini's duct and protein plaques in the pancreatic duct.

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. It is high chances of progression to necrotising pancreatitis therefore surgery is always done

questions.text: A 29-year-old NRI reports to the causality with complaints of fevers, diarrhea. abdominal pain, and skin rash for 2 days. He feels fatigued and has lost his appetite. On further questioning, he says that he returned from his missionary trip to Brazil last week. He is excited as he talks about his trip. Besides a worthy clinical experience, he also enjoyed local outdoor activities, like swimming and rafting. His past medical history is insignificant. The blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg and the pulse is 100/min. On examination, there is a rash on the legs. The rest of the examination is normal. Choose the correct diagnostic stage of the pathogen responsible for this condition.

A 42-year-old man presents with unremitting diarrhea for the past 2 weeks. He describes his bowel movements as watery, non—bloody, foul—smelling, and greasy. He also has cramping abdominal pain associated with the diarrhea. He says that his symptoms started right after he returned from a father—son camping trip to the mountains. His son has similar symptoms. A stool sample is obtained, and microscopic analysis is significant for the findings shown in the image below. Choose the correct disease caused by this pathogen.

A 4—year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his mother due to a peeling erythematous rash on his face, back, and buttocks which started this morning. Two days ago, his skin was extremely tender and within 24 hours progressed to desquamation. She also says that, for the past few weeks, he was very irritable and cried more than usual during diaper changes. The patient is up to date on his vaccinations and has been meeting all developmental milestones. On physical examination, his epidermis separates from the dermis by gentle lateral stroking of the skin. Systemic antibiotics are prescribed, and adequate fluid replacement is provided. Which of the following microorganisms most likely caused this patient's condition?

A 21-year-old man comes to the OPD with a lesion on his penis. He noted a painful ulcer on the right side of the penis 4 days ago and it has progressively increased in size since then. The patient has had no dysuria, hematuria, or penile discharge. He is a PLHIV and sexually active. The patient currently takes no medications. He appears comfortable and is afebrile. On genitourinary examination, there is a 1.5-cm ulceration on the right side of the base of the penis; this lesion is very tender and soft; has irregular, ragged borders; and is covered with grey exudate. There is no penile discharge. There is a palpable, tender, enlarged inguinal lymph node in the right groin. The examination is otherwise unremarkable. Gram stain of the scraping of the ulcer Shown in the image. Choose the correct etiological agent?

A previously healthy 8-year-old boy is brought to the clinic with fever and mouth pain that began yesterday. He has consumed an adequate amount of fluids but refuses to eat due to the pain. The patient has no medical problems and takes no medications. Physical examination reveals swollen gums and vesicular, inflamed lesions on his hard palate and lips as shown in the image. He has enlarged and tender cervical lymph nodes. Which of the following is most likely responsible for this patient's condition?

A 22-year-old previously healthy man comes to the emergency department due to fever, malaise, anorexia, and painless swelling of the left eye. His symptoms began after a month-long anthropology trip to a rural village. During his stay, he lived in an adobe house with a thatched roof and unnetted windows and doors. Physical examination shows left-sided periorbital swelling and conjunctival erythema with no discharge. The remainder of the physical examination, including right eye examination, shows no abnormalities. Giemsa-stained peripheral blood smear is shown in the image. What is the mode of transmission of this pathogen?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with worsening somnolence, lethargy, and decreased urine output. The patient has no prior medical conditions but had abdominal cramps and diarrhea several days ago that later became frankly bloody. Physical examination shows mild pallor and moist mucous membranes. Laboratory studies reveal elevated blood urea nitrogen and serum creatinine levels. Peripheral blood smear shows fragmented erythrocytes. This patient's condition is most likely related to consumption of which of the following foods?
Item shown in the image is sterilized by a physical method. Choose the correct quality control agent used for this method.

A 58-year-old asymptomatic woman comes to the OPD for a health check-up prior to starting volunteer work at a hospital. She has a history of hypothyroidism and takes levothyroxine. She does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs. Her examination findings are unremarkable. During a laboratory test, her white blood cells are incubated with mycobacterial antigens. Compared to the control, a large amount of interferon-gamma is detected in her blood sample. Which of the following cell types is most directly responsible for this finding?
Each of the following statements concerning Candida albicans is correct except

options.label: A
options.text: Candida albicans is a budding yeast that forms pseudohyphae when it invades tissue.

options.label: B
options.text: Candida albicans is transmitted primarily by respiratory aerosol

options.label: D
options.text: Impaired cell-mediated immunity is an important predisposing factor to disease

questions.correct_answer: B. Candida albicans is transmitted primarily by respiratory aerosol

questions.text: A 43-year-old man attended the vascular surgery outpatient clinic for peripheral vascular disease. He was a non-smoker but had undergone a coronary artery bypass graft the year before. Some of his laboratory results were as follows: Plasma (fasting) Cholesterol :550mg/dl,Triglyceride 590 mg/dl,HDL cholesterol :34 His apolipoprotein E genotype was E2/E2. On examination, he had tuberous xanthomata and palmar striae. What is the probable diagnosis of this case?

questions.text: A 24-year-old man is brought to your emergency department under arrest by the local police. The patient was found naked at a busy intersection jumping up and down on top of a car. Interviewing the patient, you discover that he has not slept in 2 days because he does not feel tired. He reports hearing voices. The patient was previously hospitalized 1 year ago with auditory hallucinations, paranoia, and a normal mood. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. Low-pressure high-volume cuffs provide better protection against aspiration.
